main.name: Tabatha Lewis
main.description: Mathematics of Computations UCLA graduate who is looking for work!
main.bio: I'm an eager, recent UCLA graduate! I am looking to work in AI/Software Engineering!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Mathematics of Computation, Bachelor of Science
education.description: Studied Mathematics and Computer Science. Took coursework in Biology, Chemistry, Physics and French!

work.title: Machine Learning Intern
work.description: Investigated the XGBoost Machine Learning Algorithm and its application to NBC’s recommendation engine. Conducted data analysis on datasets with hundreds of millions of entries using Python, Spark and SQL to draw data driven consumer insights. Cleaned datasets and created visualizations using DOMO to present findings.

work.title: Summer Video Engineering Intern, Fall Video Engineering Intern, Software Developer
work.description: Created internal tools such as a tool to extract id3 tags and Nielsen watermarks from live video streams (VDMS and AWS) utilizing AWS and Python and created a web interface to access the tool with React (JavaScript, HTML/CSS). Resolved issues with Verizon's API logging messages to Splunk. Worked with complex Video and API structures and formats.

work.title: Lab Consultant
work.description: Answered technology and software related questions in a time sensitive environment. Diagnosed and resolved basic hardware and software failures.

work.title: Opinion Columnist, News and A&E Contributor
work.description: Wrote articles for UCLA’s award-winning newspaper. Collected and vetted facts within time constraints by conducting informative interviews for and with the public. Quickly understood advanced research topics in a variety of fields, such as neuroscience, biology, psychology and sociology, and explained the research to the general public in a digestible manner.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern - Data
work.description: Created Python modules for risk metric analysis of stock portfolios at an AI based stock trading stealth startup. Pulled and analyzed stock data from Yahoo Finance.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: Analyzed gene expression in hundreds of thousands of cells and used R to eliminate biases introduced by the gene detection methods.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: Prepared biological samples and examined samples using imaging techniques, such as dark-field and bright-field microscopy.

skills.name: C, C++, Unix, Reg Ex, Bash/Shell, Java, Python (Numpy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib), R (ggplot) , JavaScript (d3.js, React), Unity, Matlab, Git, HTML/CSS, Spark, SQL, Tensorflow, AWS, Databricks, Splunk, Docker, Tableau, Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Suite

projects.title: Computer Vision Pill Counter: Phision.Ai
projects.category: Trained Facebook's Detectron2 to detect and count pharmacy pills. Created a application through which users can send images on their phones and run an inference on their image.

projects.title: Music Visualization Class Project
projects.category: Project for UCLA CS174A: Intro to Graphics. With two other classmates we implemented a music API, and designed a collision detection system, ray casting and mouse click from scratch.

projects.title: Daily Bruin Articles
projects.category: A link to articles I have written for the Daily Bruin.

projects.title: Her Campus Articles
projects.category: A link to articles I have written for Her Campus

testimonials.text: You en’t afraid, are you? Not yet. When I am, I shall master the fear.
A whale is as intelligent as we are, just in a way we can’t quite measure or understand. Because we’re these incredibly blunt instruments.
